data.title: Home
data.text:
Image

Experience the Best of Summer: Supervisor Joel Anderson's 2024 Summer Events List

Short Description

Get ready to mark your calendars because Supervisor Joel Anderson's office has curated a 2024 Summer Events lineup that promises to excite every member of your family.

Image

San Diego County renews support for legislation to ensure foster youths get survivor benefits

Short Description

Former foster youths and advocates are cautiously optimistic once again, after San Diego County officials endorsed new state legislation that would ensure foster children whose parents have died receive survivor benefits when they come of age — rather than allowing counties to take those benefits.

Image

How to Request Road Repairs and More from County Public Works

Short Description

Got potholes? Graffiti? Sidewalks that need repairs?

If you live in the unincorporated areas of the county, you can report road repairs needed, drainage issues, traffic problems, missing or damaged road signs and more.

Image

Rotarians hold kickoff event for Vines & Vittles festival

Short Description

Around 100 Rotarians, business leaders and others in Rancho Bernardo gathered on May 9 for the Vines & Vittles kickoff.

Image

Supervisors Advance Behavioral Health UCSD Partnership for Medi-Cal Patients

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors Tuesday unanimously advanced a proposed agreement with UC San Diego Health to provide acute psychiatric care, along with 30 to 45 additional beds, for eligible Medi-Cal patients at the university’s East Campus Medical Center.

Image

San Diego County Supervisors approve resolution calling out State Farm for canceled policies

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors unanimously approved a resolution Tuesday opposing plans by State Farm and other major insurers to reduce homeowner policies in the state.

Image

County Supervisors move forward on $19.6 million migrant transition center

Short Description

San Diego County leaders voted 4-to-1 Tuesday to accept about $19.6 million in federal money for a migrant transition day center.

Image

Board Unanimously Approves Supervisor Anderson's Partnership with the City of San Diego on Opioid Overdose Prevention and Awareness

Short Description

San Diego County Board of Supervisors unanimously approved Supervisor Joel Anderson's recommendation to partner with the City of San Diego on opioid overdoes prevention and naloxone awareness.

Image

Officials educate public about the dangers of fentanyl at Poway Library workshop

Short Description

Health and law enforcement officials were joined by San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson at a Fentanyl Safety Workshop about the dangers of the drug.

Image

East County Chamber Health Fair Saturday

Short Description

San Diego Regional East County Chamber of Commerce hosted Health Fair Saturday from 10am to 2pm at Grossmont Shopping Center, 8585 Grossmont Center Drive, La Mesa 91942.

Image

New Economic Report: San Diego County Winery Sales Reach All-Time Record of $54.5 Million in 2023, an 11% Increase Over 2022

Short Description

The San Diego County Vintners Association (SDCVA), a trade organization dedicated to supporting the San Diego winemaking community, released the 2024 San Diego County Economic Impact of Wineries report today as it celebrates San Diego Wine Week May 13 – 19 ending with its annual wine festival on Sunday, May 19 from 1 – 4 p.m. PDT.

Image

A Dream Fulfilled: Chaldean Community Council Opens Incubator Business Center in El Cajon

Short Description

Opening an incubator business center to help refugees and immigrants start new businesses has been a dream of Dr. Noori Barka for more than a decade. On April 11, that dream came to fruition at a ceremony launching the Chaldean Community Council’s new incubator business center at 405 East Lexington Avenue in El Cajon. The center will provide help for low-income and underserved refugee communities.

Image

California Official Slams 'Concierge Service' for Migrants

Short Description

The lone dissenter on the San Diego County Board of Supervisors says that more than $19 million in federal funding will not help the migrant "epicenter" in the long term.

Image

Federal Government Approves Funds for Migrant Center; County to Provide Short-Term Relief

Short Description

The federal government has approved $19.6 million for a long-term migrant and asylum-seeker transit center in San Diego County. The action comes after a migrant center in San Diego shut down in February after running out of money, and after County Supervisors asked the Biden administration for help.

Image

County passes new effort with city of San Diego to address opioid crisis

Short Description

A new plan was unanimously approved by the Board of Supervisors on Tuesday that brings the county and city of San Diego together to better confront the opioid crisis in the region.

Image

Fentanyl safety workshop to be held May 7 at Poway Library

Short Description

The rapidly spreading and extremely dangerous synthetic opiate known as fentanyl has claimed the lives of many in our community, but Supervisor Joel Anderson is bringing resources to address this crisis.

Image

Celebrating Financial Literacy: Supervisor Anderson Proclaims 'Momentum Tutoring Family Financial Fun Day'

Short Description

During the monthly Santee City Council Meeting on April 10th, Supervisor Joel Anderson stood alongside Santee Mayor John W. Minto, the San Diego Center for Economic Education at Cuyamaca College, and youth entrepreneurs to celebrate a local tutoring organization’s efforts in teaching financial literacy to families and children in Santee.

Image

Business Incubator Launched by Chaldean Community Council with $500K County Grant

Short Description

The new El Cajon Small Business Incubator will be launched by the Chaldean Community Council thanks to a $500,000 grant from San Diego County.

Image

San Diego Receives More Than $39 Million in Federal Funding to Support Migrant Services

Short Description

San Diego will receive millions in funding as part of federal monies authorized by Congress to support communities that are providing services to asylum-seekers and refugees.

Image

An Interstellar Success: Making County Government Work for Julian

Short Description

For Julian residents, preserving the dark sky is a way of life. Designated as an International Dark Sky Community in 2021, Julian is part of the mere 1% of the U.S. where the Milky Way remains visible.

Image

County waives clerical fees for people impacted by January storms

Short Description

San Diegans impacted by the severe floods earlier this year will not have to pay feeds associated with the Assessor/Recorder/County Clerk’s Office thanks to a new action by Chair Nora Vargas and Supervisor Joel Anderson.

Image

San Diego designates April 24 as Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors unanimously adopted a proclamation on Tuesday designating April 24, 2023 Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day, Asbarez reports.

Image

AMR employee from El Cajon honored for 55 years of public service

Short Description

American Medical Response hosted a special event Friday for its longest-serving employee, El Cajon-native Gordon Anderson, who has been with the company for 55 years.

Image

Graham takes center stage at Boys to Men Mentoring’s Rooted in Resiliency April 13

Short Description

A fusion of intellect and music will highlight this year’s Rooted in Resiliency to benefit Spring Valley-based Boys to Men Mentoring on April 13 at Coasterra on Harbor Island (880 Harbor Island Drive).

Image

Prop 1 Passed. Now What?

Short Description

A couple weeks after a statewide behavioral health reform measure narrowly passed, county Board of Supervisors Chair Nora Vargas says she’ll formally call for the county to prepare to make the most of it at a board meeting later this month.

Image

Clashing Takes on Solutions for San Diego’s Border Crisis

Short Description

The San Diego Board of Supervisors voted 4-1 last Tuesday to approve a plan that strategically advocates for federal and philanthropic support to fund a sustainable long-term migrant shelter.

Image

Board of Supervisors Supports Proposals to Expand Areas for Wineries, Allow Live Music

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors on Wednesday directed staff to start working on an update of the tiered winery ordinance that would allow more wineries in unincorporated areas and make it easier for boutique wineries to host live music.

Image

Ramona Businesses, Organizations get Grants from Supervisor Joel Anderson

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson awarded nearly 50 Ramona organizations and businesses with almost $1 million in grants on Feb. 13 at the Ramona Chamber of Commerce office

Image

Two Supervisors Raise Alarm as More Migrants Are Dropped on San Diego Streets

Short Description

Hundreds of migrants who recently entered the country seeking asylum are being released onto San Diego streets after county funding ran out for the migrant welcome center, with the latest bus loads released in San Ysidro Saturday morning.

Image

Supervisor Anderson Recognizes January as Blood Donor Month

Short Description

Representatives from the San Diego Blood Bank and the American Red Cross of San Diego & Imperial Counties gathered at Supervisor Anderson's District Office in El Cajon.

Image

County Supervisors OK Looking Into Child Care For Law Enforcement

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors agreed unanimously Tuesday to explore the provision of subsidized childcare services for county law enforcement employees.

Image

Supervisor Anderson Recognizes Blood Donor Month Amid Need for Blood Donations

Short Description

As the nation experiences a great need for blood donations, Supervisor Joel Anderson recognized San Diego County's blood collection organizations: the San Diego Blood Bank and the American Red Cross of San DIego & Imperial Counties.

Image

Anderson Updates Consituents in Progess on Several Fronts

Short Description

The speaker at our January meeting was County Board Supervisor Joel Anderson (pictured above).

He has been busy over the past few years with helping make San Diego County and our area better. Not only does he represent our concerns at the Supervisor’s board meetings, but his job and priority is to serve as a resource to us.

Image

Supervisor Anderson Shares His 2024 Point-in-Time County Experience in East County

Short Description

San Diego County Board Supervisor Joel Anderson jioned thousands of volunteers across the County in participating in the 2024 #WeAllCount Point-in-TIme County; San Diego County's annual homelessness census.

Image

Scholarship Opportunities

Short Description

Supervisor Joel Anderson asked his staff to compile a list of scholarship opportunities and financial resources to assist students.

Image

Supervisors OK Financial Help for Child Care Providers

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors Tuesday unanimously passed a financial aid proposal for child care providers, including help with start-up costs.

Image

Ramona Chamber Introduces New Leaders, Honors Businesses and Community Members

Short Description

Ramona Chamber of Commerce members announced the new Board of Directors and gave community recognition awards to businesses and individuals at their Gala on Sunday.

Image

Affordability, Public Safety and Homelessness Among Priorities for Elected Leaders in 2024, Part 2

Short Description

Public safety, especially from sexually violent predators and gun violence; affordability; homelessness and mental health issues are among priorities for the region’s elected leaders in 2024.

Image

Opinion: Prop. 1 Will Hamstring San Diego County's Efforts to Prevent Homelessness

Short Description

This Tuesday, the San Diego County Board of Supervisors will consider whether or not to adopt a support position on a ballot measure that could have irrevocable damage to our behavioral health system if passed. Here’s why I’ll be voting against agenda item 14, a resolution in support of Proposition 1, and what other leaders are not telling you.

Image

Ramona Woman Elected as First Unincorporated Advisory Member of SANDAG Board

Short Description

Ramona resident Robin Joy Maxson has been elected by the Association of Planning Groups, San Diego County, as the first advisory member of the SANDAG Board of Directors for unincorporated areas.

Image

County: Shared-housing Program for Seniors Planned to Start this Summer

Short Description

A San Diego County pilot program that will help residents 55 and older find a spare bedroom in a private home is expected to begin early this summer.

Image

Ramona Archway now Fully Funded, with Construction Set to Finish in the Fall

Short Description

The Ramona Archway Association was awarded a $250,000 grant by San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson to build the long-awaited Ramona archway on 10th Street where it intersects with Main Street.

Image

San Carlos Area Council Annual Potluck Social and Open House Prove Successful

Short Description

Happy New Year! I am happy to report that the SCAC annual potluck social and open house was a big success!

Image

Looking Ahead: San Diego County’s Second District Supervisor to Address Homelessness, Other Issues in 2024

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson said that looking ahead to 2024, he plans to continue to keep addressing homelessness a top priority.

Image

Alpine Park Plan Progresses

Short Description

On Dec. 6, the San Diego County Board of Supervisors unanimously voted to move forward with the construction of the Alpine Community Park.

Image

Board of Supervisors Votes to Pave Way for First County-Managed Park in Alpine

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors Wednesday voted 4-0 to certify an environmental report and authorize a construction bid for a planned park in the community of Alpine.

Image

4S Ranch-Del Sur Community Foundation Changes Focus, Designates $160K Endowment for Library

Short Description

4S Ranch-Del Sur Community Foundation leadership has decided to no longer seek members and designate its $160,000 endowment to benefit the 4S Ranch Library.

Image

Grant Recipient Appreciation Event Honoring Supervisor Joel Anderson

Short Description

In recognition of San Diego County Board Supervisor Joel Anderson's contributions to the business and non-profit communities of District 2 through County grant allocations, Mi-Box San Diego and the San Diego East County Regional Chamber of Commerce hosted an appreciation event for Supervisor Anderson.

Image

San Diego Sheriff's Department Unveils New Helicopters

Short Description

The San Diego Sheriff's Department is adding two new helicopters to its ASTREA (Aerial Support to Regional Enforcement Agencies) fleet. One is a patrol helicopter, to help locate suspects on the run and missing people. The other is an advanced firefighting chopper.

Image

Family Reunification Pilot Program Launches in East County

Short Description

A pilot program for cities in East County is in the works to help people experiencing homelessness get reunited with their loved ones.

Image

Poway’s Holiday with Heroes seeks Donations, Sponsors and Volunteers for Dec. 7 Event

Short Description

The annual Holiday with Heroes in Poway is looking for donations, sponsors and heroes to make its Christmas shopping event a success for underserved children and their families.

Image

County leaders honor 25 ‘Most Remarkable Teens’

Short Description

On Thursday night, Nov. 9, before a crowd that included county and city leaders, Stephanie, and her sister, Samantha, were two of the teens recognized at San Diego County’s annual “25 Most Remarkable Teens” ceremony.

Image

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson Joins Jamul Casino® and The Jamul Indian Village of California Tribe in Honoring Veterans

Short Description

Yesterday, Supervisor Joel Anderson of the San Diego County Board of Supervisors joined Jamul Casino and the Jamul Indian Village of California Tribe to commemorate Veterans Day with an exclusive event at Jamul Casino.

Image

San Diego Board of Supervisors Votes in Favor of Drafting an Unsafe Camping Ordinance

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors voted 4-0 Tuesday in favor of drafting an unsafe camping ordinance similar to ones recently passed in the cities of San Diego and Poway in an effort to curb homeless encampments.

Image

Supervisor Anderson’s Packed Agenda for This Tuesday’s Board Meeting

Short Description

Supervisor Joel Anderson is proposing three actions at this Tuesday’s Board of Supervisors meeting, focused on protecting taxpayers, addressing homelessness, and honoring American lives lost in Israel.

Image

Local Leaders Call on Congress to Pass Afghan Adjustment Act aboard USS Midway

Short Description

Dozens of veterans, Afghan refugees and elected representatives on Thursday called on Congress to pass legislation to assist Afghans who worked with and for coalition forces in America’s longest war to come to the United States.

Image

East County Leaders & First Responders Honored 9/11

Short Description

Supervisor Joel Anderson and Grossmont College held a 9/11 Memorial Ceremony in remembrance of the 22nd anniversary of the devastating terrorist attacks against the United States.

Image

County Supervisor Joel Anderson to Host Workshop for First-Time Homebuyers

Short Description

San Diego County Superviso Joel Anderson is co-hosting a First-Time Homeowners Buyers Workshop on Thursday, Sept. 28 in Rancho Bernardo with the North San Diego County Associaion of Realtors and Pacific Southwest Association of Realtors.

Image

Local Politicians Speak Out over Mass Migrant Drop-offs at Transit Stations

Short Description

As U.S. Customs and Border Protection agents continue to drop off hundreds of migrants at transit centers throughout San Diego County Friday, local politicians are speaking out against the policy.

Image

Supervisors Approve Review of Bed Capacity for Mental Health Care

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors Tuesday unanimously approved an effort to increase the number of beds for Medi-Cal eligible county residents needing mental health treatment.

Image

Nominate Your Community Hero

Short Description

Everyone knows a “hero” who has made a positive impact on their personal lives or their community. Whether it be a neighbor who goes the extra mile for someone in need, a teacher who reignites one’s love for learning, or a coach who helps students achieve their goals, there is no shortage of kindness amongst County Supervisor Joel Anderson’s constituents.

Image

San Diego County approves developing shared senior housing program

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors voted unanimously Tuesday to develop a shared housing program for people aged 55 and older.

Image

Who is a hero in your neighborhood?

Short Description

Everyone knows a “hero” who has made a positive impact on their personal lives or their community.

Image

Young Entrepreneurs Show Off Their Skills at Children’s Business Fair

Short Description

The future of small business is bright in Santee. Nearly 50 youth-run businesses filled the gymnasium at West Hills High School showing off products as diverse as donut shaped soaps, campfire starters made from flowers and micro-aquariums with live fish swimming around small glass bottles.

Image

Caltrans Project in Ramona Adds Colored Crosswalks, Painted Posts to Business District

Short Description

Crews have completed a $1.2 million project to improve safety and walkability in the Ramona Historic Business District.

Image

Supervisor Joel Anderson addresses highlights of 2023-24 budget for Ramona

Short Description

The County 2023-24 budget is $8.17 billion, which will be used to fight homelessness; take on mental health and substance use disorder challenges; improve the justice system; help working families; and invest in core services like roads, fire protection, and parks, officials said in a press release.

Image

Anderson Alert: Fixing Our Roads

Short Description

Road Work Ahead! The Board approved over 100 miles of road resurfacing projects throughout our County-maintained roads systems at our June Board meeting.

Image

Up to $40K Available for Aspiring San Diego Homeowners in BIPOC Community

Short Description

The San Diego Housing Commission on Thursday began a pilot program to assist middle-income Black, Indigenous and people of color who are first-time homebuyers.

Image

Post 5867 Hosted Wellness Fair in East County

Short Description

The Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 5867, located in the beautiful community of Lakeside, graciously hosted an East County Wellness Fair to connect veterans who are currently experiencing homelessness, or those at-risk of becoming homeless, with over twenty different organizations who specialize in providing veteran support and resources.

Image

Anderson Alert: Summer Events

Short Description

With temperatures beginning to heat up and students heading into summer break, my office compiled a list of free and family-friendly summer events happening across San Diego County.

Image

County GRAZE Event Highlights the Importance of Agriculture in San Diego

Short Description

San Diego is well known for its warm weather, but stormy skies didn’t stop the local agricultural community from coming together for the San Diego County Farm Bureau’s GRAZE event. Held at the beautiful Carlsbad Flower Fields, this robust affair brought together community leaders and industry professionals to celebrate the vital role that local farms play in the San Diego community.

Image

Sup. Joel Anderson: Unincorporated area residents need SANDAG representation

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson and community group planning members held a press conference Tuesday to advocate for unincorporated area representation on SANDAG.

Image

Opinion: Thousands of innocent Americans have gone to prison. How can lawmakers right those wrongs?

Short Description

With the help of the California Innocence Project, I introduced two bills that were later signed into law by Gov. Jerry Brown to make things better.

Image

Additional mobile camera unit will be deployed in El Cajon

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson, who represents the area including El Cajon, awarded the City of El Cajon a more than $40,000 grant from county funds to purchase another mobile camera trailer.

Image

The end of Title 42 leads to more police surveillance equipment in El Cajon

Short Description

They've made long, dangerous journeys from all over the world. San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson says asylum seekers shouldn't feel in danger once they reach the United States.

Image

San Diego County officials, immigration advocates call for federal help with anticipated migrant surge

Short Description

As waves of migrants gather at the U.S.-Mexico border in anticipation of Title 42 expiring next week, San Diego County officials and immigration advocates are asking for more help from the federal government to handle the anticipated influx.

Image

San Diego Group Works to Highlight the Role Spiders Play in a Balanced Ecosystem

Short Description

The San Diego Spider Society recently organized a community event at the Walter Andersen Nursery in Poway, where founder Randy Supczak presented information about the native arachnids in the area.

Image

County Supervisors recognize ‘Not Me San Diego’

Short Description

San Diego County Gun Owners’ NotMeSD women’s program to stop sexual assault and domestic violence is honored with NotMe Day!

Image

Supervisor Anderson Hosts Santee Community Coffee Town Hall Meeting

Short Description

On April 26th, 2023, San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson and the Santee Chamber of Commerce co-hosted a Community Coffee Town Hall meeting for Santee residents to voice their concerns on issues that most mattered to them.

Image

Local Military Hero Honored at San Diego Gulls Game

Short Description

On February 19, 2023, veteran Thomas Girard was honored as the “Military Hero of the Game” by the American Hockey League’s San Diego Gulls. The Gulls fought valiantly as they took on the Bakersfield Condors.

Image

Supervisor Anderson to Host Santee Community Coffee Town Hall

Short Description

On Wednesday, April 26, San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson will co-host a Community Coffee Town Hall with the Santee Chamber of Commerce.

Image

RB Sunrise Rotary Club hosts workshop on elder scam and abuse prevention

Short Description

The Rancho Bernardo Sunrise Rotary Club hosted an Elder Scam and Abuse Prevention Community Workshop on March 22 to bring the community together to discuss and expose the inner workings of maliciously intended organizations and people that target the elderly.

Image

Supervisors OK Expanded ‘Live Well on Wheels’ Fleet for Homeless Outreach

Short Description

San Diego County supervisors voted 4-0 Tuesday in favor of expanding a program to offer mobile outreach services to those living on the street.

Image

County Grants Given to Julian Nonprofits

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors approved grants to the Julian Chamber of Commerce, Backcountry Communities Thriving, Warner Unified School District, and Julian 4th of July Parade, Inc.

Image

San Diego County Library Grand Opening Lakeside Branch

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson and the San Diego County Library held a Grand Opening Ribbon Cutting Ceremony for the new Lakeside Library.

Image

Anderson Introduces Pilot Program to Reduce Hospital Readmission Rates for Rural Communities

Short Description

At the Tuesday, March 14 San Diego County Board of Supervisors meeting, Supervisor Joel Anderson, who represents the East County communities of District 2, introduced an agenda item aimed at reducing hospital readmission rates for rural San Diego County residents.

Image

Anderson calls for more recreation near reservoirs

Short Description

San Diego’s reservoirs provide much more to the region beyond storing water. They give thousands of residents and visitors an opportunity to enjoy recreational activities, including fishing, boating, overnight camping, and other day use amenities and are an economic engine for the region.

Image

Opinion: Our County’s Unincorporated Communities Need Representation on SANDAG’s Board

Short Description

Adding an advisory member to the SANDAG board to represent the region’s unincorporated communities — someone well-versed in the unique challenges and needs of our county’s vast rural territory — would be a positive first step towards guaranteeing that all San Diegans have a voice and a vote when it comes to SANDAG decisions.

Image

Nurses will follow up with people discharged from hospitals to rural areas in effort to reduce readmissions

Short Description

Nurses will soon be following up with people discharged from the hospital to rural communities in an effort to reduce readmission rates that have been climbing in isolated parts of the region.

Image

Supervisor wants county to lower rural hospital readmission rates

Short Description

County Supervisor Joel Anderson on Tuesday introduced a proposal that would lower hospital readmission rates for rural San Diego County residents.

Image

Poway’s Hidden Haven for Therapeutic Horse Riding

Short Description

Hidden among the rolling hills of Poway, San Diego lies Ride Above Disability Therapeutic Riding Center, a nonprofit ranch and prized gem of the community.

Image

Supervisor Joel Anderson hosts community town hall

Short Description

SAN DIEGO (KUSI) – Community Supervisor Joel Anderson held a Town Hall Meeting in Poway on Wednesday to discuss the issues on the minds of his constituents.

Image

Jamul Little League Ballpark Opening Day Ceremony

Short Description

The Back Country of Jamul banned together physically and financially over the past four months to build a new Little League Ballpark.

Image

Officials unveil Ramona Historic Colonnade signs to recognize historic trees

Short Description

Signs that honor the community’s towering rows of eucalyptus trees as part of the Ramona Historic Colonnade were unveiled during a ceremony Tuesday on state Route 67.

Image

Dine & Dialogue with Supervisor Anderson

Short Description

San Diego Regional East County Chamber of Commerce hosted a Dine & Dialogue Luncheon with San Diego County Board Supervisor, District 2, Joel Anderson.

Image

Supervisors OK Homelessness Reduction Efforts in East County, Also Fed Plan

Short Description

In a separate proposal from Joel Anderson, supervisors directed Robbins-Meyer to find a potential site or convert a hotel in the unincorporated region of East County, as a way to increase shelter capacity.

Image

Supervisor Anderson Introduces Himself to the Tierrasanta Community

Short Description

Hello, Tierrasanta! I am Supervisor Joel Anderson, your elected representative for the County of San Diego’s Second District. I wanted to take this opportunity to properly introduce myself seeing that, due to recent redistricting, my district now encompasses the Tierrasanta community. I am honored to represent you and your families on the San Diego County Board of Supervisors.

Image

Supervisor Anderson hosts Community Coffee

Short Description

On Wednesday, March 8, San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson will be co-hosting a Community Coffee Town Hall with the Poway Chamber of Commerce.

Image

County Supervisor Joel Anderson Participates in El Cajon Point-in-Time Count

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson participated in this year's Point-in-Time Count in El Cajon. The El Cajon Count took place from 4-6 am.

Image

The San Diego Futures Foundation, County brighten holidays for area kids

Short Description

The San Diego Futures Foundation and County of San Diego joined forces back in December to make the holiday season brighter for children in foster care through their annual computer distribution.

Image

Anderson comments on County's efforts to prepare for end of Title 42

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson said the county is preparing for more [migration] efforts like this to happen, along with more migrant drop-offs when shelters are full, because Title 42 is expected to end soon.

Image

Opinion: What I learned volunteering to count East County’s homeless population in January

Short Description

While it was inspiring to see progress in some areas, we were also reminded of the significant need for services in others.

Image

County Supervisors OK Plan to Assist Migrants with Potential End of Title 42

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors Tuesday unanimously called for the development of a comprehensive plan to respond to a possible influx of asylum seekers in light of the potential lifting of the federal Title 42 policy.

Image

4S Ranch Library celebrates the ‘Year of the Rabbit’

Short Description

The 4S Ranch Library celebrated Lunar New Year on Jan. 25.

Image

Supervisors OK Upgrades to Popular Mount Woodson Hiking Area

Short Description

County supervisors Wednesday unanimously approved upgrades to a popular hiking spot near the community of Ramona and the city of Poway.

Image

Grants Available for Sports Leagues & Organizations

Short Description

As your County Supervisor, I believe that sports leagues and organizations are integral to the foundation of our communities through the strong lessons they teach our children and as a healthy recreational outlet for residents of all ages.

Image

Supervisors OK Plan That Will Revitalize Campo Road Corridor in East County

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors voted 4-0 Wednesday to revitalize a main commercial street and adjacent residential area in Casa de Oro, an unincorporated East County community.

Image

Board of Supervisors vote unanimously to support home-school sites in placement restrictions of sex predators

Short Description

The Board of Supervisors on Wednesday voted unanimously to support the same restrictions on home-school sites as public or private schools when placing sexually violent predators.

Image

Grueling, early morning count collects vital data on county’s homeless

Short Description

About 1,600 volunteers throughout San Diego County walked down dark streets, peered into vehicle windows, drove through neighborhoods, and walked unmarked trails in the pre-dawn hours Thursday in an annual effort to learn more about the area’s homeless population.

Image

Anderson wants money for refugees

Short Description

On Dec. 23, Congress approved reimbursing the Federal Emergency Management Agency up to $785 million for costs related to emergency shelters and services to asylum seekers.

Image

Federal government drops migrants across the country with few resources

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson addressed the public over Christmas weekend, calling these transfers of migrants neglectful.

Image

From homelessness to jail deaths to climate: What San Diego supervisors did in 2022 and have planned for 2023

Short Description

San Diego County supervisors expanded behavioral health services, invested in homeless shelters and moved to curb climate change over the past year — actions they say reflect a philosophical shift toward greater county involvement in such efforts.

Image

County Leader Seeks Aid After Hundreds of Migrants Dropped off in San Diego

Short Description

Anderson sent two letters, one to Gov. Gavin Newsom and the other to President Joe Biden, asking for resources to handle the influx of asylum seekers. Part of Anderson's plan to get more resources to the community includes applying for funding from FEMA.

Image

Federal government “abandons” migrants at San Diego transit centers

Short Description

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson addressed the public over Christmas weekend, calling these transfers of migrants neglectful.

Image

ANDERSON RAISES CONCERNS OVER COUNTY’S PROPOSAL FOR CANNABIS BUSINESSES IN UNINCORPORATED AREAS

Short Description

Supervisor Anderson has posted a survey for constituents to voice their views.

Image

Opinion: East County Needs More Federal Resources to Avert Migrant Humanitarian Crisis

Short Description

We want to welcome people into our community in a safe and humane way, but local governments do not have budgets to support hundreds to thousands of asylum seekers — that is the job of the Federal government and we can’t do it without their help.

Image

East County leaders call for state, federal resources for incoming asylum-seekers

Short Description

East County leaders held a news conference at the El Cajon Transit Center Thursday, saying it is an anticipated drop-off location for hundreds of asylum-seekers if the U.S. Supreme Court lifts a Trump-era rule known as Title 42. The Biden administration wants that to happen just after Christmas.

Image

San Diego Supervisor warns of influx of migrants when Title 42 ends

Short Description

CBS 8 spoke with Republican County Supervisor Joel Anderson and a local immigration advocate with The American Friends Service Committee, both say that if and when those people cross the border that it’s going to overwhelm the system.

Image

County Supervisor Anderson addresses “misuse” of taxpayer funds

Short Description

County Supervisor Joel Anderson wrote an internal memo released to the County’s CAO on Dec. 15 which stated:

I believe any allegations regarding the potential misuse of taxpayer funds and resources must be taken very seriously if we are to continue to ensure the public we serve that the County of San Diego prioritizes our role as responsible stewards of all County assets.

Image

Supervisors OK policies to combat fentanyl, opioid crisis

Short Description

County supervisors voted 4-0 Tuesday in favor of a set of policies and tools, including an education program, to combat the opioid/fentanyl crisis.

Image

Honoring Our Veterans: East County Veterans’ Halls Awarded County Grants

Short Description

Supervisor Anderson knows the importance of veterans’ halls to our military community, and in 2021, learned that many of East County’s veteran halls were in desperate need of repairs. Shortly after assuming office as County supervisor, Anderson committed to setting aside County grant funding specifically for his district’s veterans halls to ensure they could stay open and continue serving our community.

Image

Willie O’Ree Day proclaimed in San Diego County

Short Description

O’Ree was presented with a county proclamation declaring Nov. 19 “Willie O’Ree Day” throughout San Diego County by San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson, an avid Gulls fan. As San Diego County continues tackling the issue of where to place sexually violent predators, Supervisor Joel Anderson, representing District 2, joined KUSI’s Ginger Jeffries on Good Evening San Diego to discuss what action he is taking.

Gratitude for service

Short Description

San Diego County District 2 Supervisor Joel Anderson (right) presented Serving Seniors President and CEO, Paul Downey with a certificate of recognition in honor of its decades of providing services to low-income and homeless older adults in San Diego County, including in East County communities.

Image

The county listened

Short Description

Most of us that live in Alpine have traveled thru the Alpine Blvd./Arnold /West Victoria intersection and the confusing signage if in the left lane on West Victoria that allows a right turn onto Arnold from the left lane. I presented this problem to Supervisor Joel Anderson...

Image

Supervisors Anderson & Vargas in Support of Homes Kitchens

Short Description

Thursday, September 9, Supervisor Joel Anderson and Vice Chair Nora Vargas hosted a press conference in support of "MEHKOs", or microenterprise home kitchen operations.

Image

Ramona Stater Bros. employees honored for courage as essential workers by Supervisor Anderson

Short Description

Grocery store employees at Stater Bros. Markets in Ramona received a surprise visit from District 2 Supervisor Joel Anderson, who honored them for their dedication to the community as essential workers throughout the COVID-19 pandemic.

Image

Supervisor Anderson asks public to take survey on improving County transparency

Short Description

For his first initiative as County Supervisor, East County’s representative Joel Anderson established the Transparency Subcommittee to solicit ideas from the public to improve access and participation with their County government. At a recent hearing, over 60 people attended and hundreds sent in comments with “great suggestions to ensure the public’s interest is best served,” says Anderson.

Image

Cravory Cookies opens in College Area

Short Description

On Aug. 26, Cravory Cookies celebrated the grand opening of their new College Area location with local families, lots of laughs, and gourmet cookies. A representative of County Supervisor Joel Anderson, Mariko Nakawatase, presented the Cravory Cookies team with an official Certificate of Recognition congratulating them on their new business venture.

Image

San Diego County Board's Transparency Committee holds first public meeting

Short Description

Plenty of people filled the seats at the San Diego County Board of Supervisors chambers on Tuesday evening.

They had gathered for the first public meeting of the Transparency Committee held by Supervisors Joel Anderson and Nora Vargas.

Image

Supervisor Anderson opposes declaring ‘COVID-19 misinformation’ a public health crisis

Short Description

Late Tuesday evening, the Board of Supervisors voted 3-2 down party lines to declare “COVID- 19 misinformation” a public health crisis and to adopt a series of recommendations to actively combat it. County Supervisor Joel Anderson, who voted no, discussed his opposition with KUSI’s Matt Prichard on Good Evening San Diego.

Image

County Joins Region’s Largest Government-Run Power Purchasing Agency

Short Description

With the 3-2 party-line vote, customers in the county would automatically shift to San Diego Community Power’s energy rates unless they opt to stay with SDG&E at an appointed date. Republican Supervisors Jim Desmond and Joel Anderson, who both represent large swaths of rural unincorporated county land, opposed the decision.

Image

San Diego County Declares COVID Misinformation 'Public Health Crisis'

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors on Tuesday night approved a measure declaring medical misinformation a public health crisis. The board voted 3-2 to approve the measure at the end of a 15-hour meeting. All three Democrats on the board voted to approve the measure, and two Republicans voted against it.

Image

Santa Ysabel bakery honored for supporting community during pandemic

Short Description

The staff at Dudley’s Bakery in Santa Ysabel has received special recognition from San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson.

Image

San Diego County Supervisors OK Federal Pandemic Funds To Help Fire Districts

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors Tuesday approved transferring $4 million in federal funds to independent fire protection districts to help them combat the COVID-19 pandemic.

Image

Some kids returned from Afghanistan are back in Cajon Valley classrooms

Short Description

The Cajon Valley Union School District confirmed that three families stranded in Afghanistan are safely back in El Cajon.

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson, who last week wrote a letter to President Biden about the gravity of the situation for his constituents, said on Monday that he was relieved to hear that the El Cajon kids returned safely and “are back in school where they belong.”

Image

Benefits of an internship

Short Description

The beginning of my final quarter at the University of California – San Diego, I was distressed. I had decided that I no longer desired to attend law school and was increasingly anxious that my lack of direction and a resume would leave me unemployed after graduation. Thankfully, a representative of then- California State Senator Joel Anderson came to my class to speak about Anderson’s internship program.

Image

Pendleton Marines Among Casualties as 2 More San Diego Families Escape Kabul

Short Description

Two more San Diego-area families that were trapped in the Kabul region of Afghanistan have successfully been evacuated from the country, a congressman said Friday, while two Camp Pendleton Marines were identified among the casualties of a deadly suicide bombing.

San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson wrote a letter to President Joe Biden on Thursday urging the State Department’s assistance in evacuating the families.

Image

Legal Marijuana Shops Are Taking on the Black Market

Short Description

“I’m in a tough spot,” Anderson said. “I absolutely support legal cannabis businesses, but I also have a duty to my constituents, who are rightly and loudly complaining about the harm done to them by these illegal dispensaries. It is affecting quality of life and the safety of their communities.”

Image

Supervisors OK proposal for more law enforcement on illegal pot shops

Short Description

The proposal by Supervisor Joel Anderson allows the county to speed up the receivership process, allowing the county to take control of properties whose owners have repeatedly violated the law by illegally selling cannabis.

Image

Notes from Joel: Prepare against wildfires

Short Description

With hot temperatures and strong winds approaching San Diego County, it’s time for us to prepare for potential wildfires. East County is especially prone to wildfires, so each of us has an individual responsibility to prepare ahead of time and be ready to evacuate. Although the backcountry is typically hit the hardest, it’s not unlikely that a fire could start in the Mission Trails area.

Image

Supervisor Anderson plans to increase enforcement capabilities against illegal pot shops

Short Description

Supervisor Joel Anderson introduced an ordinance that would expedite the receivership process for County Counsel to take control of properties that have repeatedly violated the law by selling cannabis in unincorporated communities.

Image

Lakeside library closer to reality

Short Description

The new Lakeside Library groundbreaking, held July 29 at its future site on Woodside Avenue, was less about the upcoming construction and more about announcing some of the elements library stakeholders included in an effort to meet community needs.

Image

County: Be ready for wildfire risk

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors July 13 approved spending $2.5 million on roadside vegetation management, followed by a July 16 Wildfire Preparedness bulletin generally warning East County residents: wildfire prevention is being funded but residents have to plan ahead.

Image

San Diego expands cool zones, free rides during heat waves

Short Description

San Diego County leaders Wednesday announced several ways for seniors, people with underlying health conditions and residents who are easily affected when temperatures rise to keep cool during heat waves -- including free cool zones, fans, drinking fountains and free transportation.

Image

SANDAG board moves ahead with project labor agreement negotiations

Short Description

The regional planning board responsible for the infrastructure needs of San Diego County voted Friday to open negotiations with local labor leaders for an agreement that would ensure construction workers on future projects are paid union wages.

Image

San Diego County officials tout wildfire response, urge residents to prepare

Short Description

County leaders presented plans Friday for a quick response to wildfires and discussed recent investments in wildfire prevention. During a press conference at Gillespie Field in which they residents were urged to take steps to protect their homes, Supervisors Joel Anderson and Nathan Fletcher were joined by representatives from Cal Fire, the county Fire Protection District, San Diego Sheriff's Department and San Diego Fire-Rescue.

Image

San Diego County tackles housing shortage with general plan changes

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors took steps to resolve regional housing shortages Wednesday by approving amendments to the housing and safety elements of the county’s general plan and by adding a new environmental justice element to it.

Image

Anderson’s Corner: Supervisors support Anderson’s plan to shut down illegal pot shops

Short Description

San Diego County District 2 Supervisor Joel Anderson, who represents cities and communities in the East County, garnered support from his board colleagues to allocate additional funds in the 20-21 fiscal year budget passed June 29 toward shutting down illegal cannabis dispensaries, or “pot shops.”

Image

County approves $7.2 billion budget with big investments in mental health, public safety

Short Description

Supervisor Joel Anderson underscored the importance of county government to his constituents, many of whom live in unincorporated communities outside of city boundaries and count on the county for public services.

Image

County’s COVID-19 relief funds get a boost

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors allocated more than $650 million of American Rescue Plan Act funds, known as ARPA funding on June 8 with the majority of the dollars slated for ongoing COVID-19 response costs, homeless services and small business support.

Image

County sets pot guidelines

Short Description

At the San Diego County Board of Supervisor’s meeting on June 9, the board voted for specific details to staff after giving its 90-day report in providing economic and equity access for the cannabis industry in the county.

Image

Supervisors Approve Plan to Spend Nearly $650M Federal Aid, Emphasis on COVID Response

Short Description

A draft plan for spending nearly $650 million in American Rescue Plan funding, with an emphasis on helping San Diego County residents affected by the COVID-19 pandemic, was approved Tuesday by the Board of Supervisors.

Image

Supervisor Joel Anderson reacts to SVP not being placed at Mt. Helix home

Short Description

A judge has ruled that a 78-year-old second sexually violent predator recommended for supervised release at a residence in the Mount Helix neighborhood will not be placed at the home.

Image

Anderson addresses support for his communities who are living at poverty level

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors Tuesday unanimously approved a transfer of nearly $16.7 million in funding for numerous infrastructure projects, including a bridge in Del Mar and youth center in the Mira Mesa neighborhood.

Image

Supervisors To Debate Fees For Development In Car-Centric Areas

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors is set this week to discuss a proposal that would slap new fees on development in car-centric communities, with the goal of incentivizing growth in more urban neighborhoods.

Image

Press conference held at rejected placement site for sexually violent predator

Short Description

Mount Helix residents are celebrating the first victory in the legal battle to fight the placement of sexually violent predators in their neighborhood.

SVP placement irks Anderson

Short Description

District 2 Supervisor Joel Anderson held a press conference on April 18, condemning the “dumping” of sexually violent predators in East County.

Supervisors approve better public notification on sex offenders

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors has unanimously approved methods intended to increase public notification about registered sex offenders and placement of sexually violent predators.

Image

Supervisor Joel Anderson: Too Many Sex Offenders Are Being Placed In East County Homes

Short Description

On a sunny spring day in El Cajon’s Wells Park, a call for equity from Supervisor Joel Anderson; equity when it comes to the placement of sexually violent predators who’ve done their time, and now must be released.

Image

County OKs Dept. of Homeless Solutions

Short Description

The County Board of Supervisors voted unanimously on April 6 to create a centralized Department of Homeless Solutions and Equitable Communities that would fall under the larger county department of Health and Human Services.

Image

Judge to decide if predator will live in East County neighborhood

Short Description

Elected officials and residents weighed in Tuesday on the proposed placement of a convicted sex offender in a supervised home in the Mount Helix neighborhood.

Image

Guest column: Protecting our region from wildfires

Short Description

Those of us who live in San Diego County know that the best way to protect our homes and property from wildfires is by doing whatever can be done, not during or after a crisis, but before an event occurs.

Image

San Diego County will update the housing element in its general plan

Short Description

San Diego County is considering adding an environmental justice element to its general plan, updating its safety plans, and adjusting its housing plans to discourage residential development in sites with very high natural hazards.

Image

County creates homeless department, launches North County outreach

Short Description

The county’s efforts to help homeless people will expand beyond the unincorporated area and into cities as part of a new department created by the Board of Supervisors on Tuesday, April 6.

Image

San Diego County moves to join a community choice energy program

Short Description

The· San Diego County Supervisory Board Late Tuesday night, the county’s unincorporated region takes a step towards joining one of two community selective aggregation programs in the region that act as an alternative to San Diego Gas & Electric for energy contract purchases.

Image

Supervisors OK COVID-related grants, discuss future ARPA funding

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors voted today to accept nearly $124 million in state funding for with contact tracing, mitigation and other strategies in combating further spread of the coronavirus.

Image

County Supervisors Back House Bill to Bolster Firearms Background Checks

Short Description

The county Board of Supervisors Tuesday voted 3-2 to support state and federal legislation that furthers gun safety reforms, including stronger background checks for firearm purchases.

Image

Anderson’s Corner: The supervisor’s first monthly column

Short Description

Hello friends. As you may know, I was sworn in on Jan. 4 to represent you on the San Diego County Board of Supervisors after the retirement of former Supervisor Dianne Jacob, who served our community well. I wanted to take a moment and let you know of the ways that my office can be of assistance to you.

Image

County Supervisors OK Lease For Future Warehouse In El Cajon

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors unanimously approved a 50-year ground lease for a property near Gillespie Field on Wednesday where a 141,360-square-foot distribution center is planned.

Image

Supervisor Anderson plays key role in allowing craft breweries to resume normal operations

Short Description

Thanks to work done by San Diego County Supervisor Joel Anderson, San Diego craft breweries will now be allowed to operate and serve alcohol on their premises without having to serve food; which was a requirement put in place by Gov. Newsom . . .

Image

San Diego County extends timeline for introducing new cannabis permits

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors had planned to roll out a new permitting process for cannabis businesses in six months, but they decided Wednesday to push that back.

Image

SD County Supervisors OK $6.4M To Clean Up El Monte Preserve

Short Description

The San Diego County Board of Supervisors voted unanimously Wednesday in favor of spending $6.4 million to preserve open space, protect habitat and ensure proper cleanup of the El Monte River Valley property it purchased from the Helix Water District last month.

Image

County Supervisors Want More Input Before Cannabis Ordinance Vote

Short Description

County supervisors Wednesday voted 4-1 to seek more public feedback before approving any policies that would promote economic access and social equity in the cannabis industry in unincorporated communities.

Image

San Diego County Supervisors vote to end charging jail inmates for phone calls

Short Description

County supervisors Tuesday unanimously voted to end the practice of charging jail inmates for phone calls and video visits. During its virtual meeting, the board also directed Chief Administrative Officer Helen-Robbins Meyer to restructure or terminate the existing contract with Securus Technologies.
